verb.description: Go or move in an exaggeratedly impatient or angry manner.
examples: he stood up in a fury and flounced out

noun.description: An exaggerated action, typically intended to express one's annoyance or impatience.
examples: she left the room with a flounce

origin: Early 18th century: from an alteration of obsolete frounce a fold or pleat, from Old French fronce, of Germanic origin; related to ruck.
